definition: to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: It is one of the famous paintings in the ancient Eygptian history.
sentences.chinese: 这是古老的埃及史上最著名的油画之一。

sentences.english: The city is noted for its handicrafts. Population, 745,000.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以手工艺品著名。

sentences.english: Reshetnikov was a celebrated Soviet pilot who fought on the Eastern Front in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 列舍特尼科夫是2战中东线战线的著名苏联飞行员。

sentences.english: Once (he was)a worker , Pang Long now becomes a famous singer.
sentences.chinese: 庞龙曾经是个工人，现在变成一位著名的歌手。

sentences.english: Some of the most notable cheeses of the world are Brie and Roquefort .
sentences.chinese: 世界最著名的奶酪是法国布里奶酪和羊乳奶酪。

sentences.english: As a celebrated scholar living abroad, Ho Peng Yoke is devoted to the study of history of Chinese science and technology.
sentences.chinese: 何丙郁先生是海外研究中国科技史的一位著名学者。

sentences.english: "The Nutcracker" is one of the most popular ballets in the world.
sentences.chinese: “胡桃夹子”是世界上最著名的芭蕾舞剧之一。

sentences.english: Sheyang Lake was a famous large lake in North Jiangsu in historical period.
sentences.chinese: 射阳湖是苏北历史上著名的大湖。

sentences.english: Her Louboutin ankle boots provide that high-fashion edge she's become famous for.
sentences.chinese: 她的鲁布托过膝靴提供了她著名的高级时尚感。

sentences.english: Cui Yongyuan is a famous talk show host .
sentences.chinese: 崔永元是著名的脱口秀主持人。

sentences.english: The Dogon are best known for their masked dances, wooden sculptures and architecture.
sentences.chinese: 多贡是最著名的为他们的蒙面舞蹈，木雕和建筑。

sentences.english: The oboist is well known for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 这位双簧管吹奏者以即兴演奏而著名。

sentences.english: The Thunderbolt gained fame as the most powerful and actively used American fighter-bomber used extensively for targeting ground installations.
sentences.chinese: 没想到雷电因此成为了美国最著名的战斗轰炸机。

sentences.english: Russian cuisine is famous for its soups such as borscht and meat dishes.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯菜以它的各种汤和荤菜著名于世。

sentences.english: The Polya urn problem is a famous model of wide application in probability.
sentences.chinese: 波利亚罐问题是概率论中的著名模型。

definition: to be famous far and wide (idiom)
well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
